channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report X-2024030713
item.description:
Report X-2024030713

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was placed in a pick up location to be loaded into a trailer to continue heading towards its destination. Package was found leaking by a package handler who would have taken it to the load end. Package was left at pickup area to be handled by certified hazmat personnel. Proceeded to collect package with proper PPE for the substance. DescribePack: Package seal leaked, causing isopropanol liquids to leak from wipe containers. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed from original container and was relocated to a salvage drum.

item.title: Report E-2024030393
item.description:
Report E-2024030393

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 13, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1903 was damaged by falling freight and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN1903-impacted trailer and concrete. All impacted material was collected and containerized into three (3) 35-gallon drums and the patched tote was placed on a spill pallet. All waste was staged in the R+L heat room for transport and disposal. The crew returned the next day to perform a tote transfer. TLE personnel transferred the product from the damaged 330-gallon tote into a new 375-gallon tote to be shipped off to its destination. The generated waste from the transfer was collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum. All waste and the damaged tote was staged in the R+L heat room for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024030604
item.description:
Report X-2024030604

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: HAMILTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE WAS SENT TO BE REWRAPPED DUE TO A WET SPOT VISIBLE ON THE OUTER BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED FOUR X 20 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FAULTLESS HEAVY FINISH IRONING SPRAY. ONE CAN WAS LEAKING DUE TO MISSING THE CAP ON THE CAN. THIS CAUSED THE NOZZLE TO DISPERSE APPROXIMATELY 5 OUNCES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER X8003V, HARTFORD TECHNOLOGY - DC, 7806 BRAYGREEN RD, LAUREL MD 20707-5169.

item.title: Report E-2024030247
item.description:
Report E-2024030247

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the concrete terminal floor and estimated that one (1) quart of material was released due to a lose valve on one (1) 330-gallon metal tote. Hepaco personnel stated that the released material evaporated, and the contractor could not confirm the size of the impacted area and examined the ball valve and determined that there was no damage, just not properly tightened. The ball valve was tightened, and the cargo was shipped on to the consignee. No waste was generated from this response.

RESPONDER WENT OUTSIDE, WORE REQUIRED PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE), FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, CLEANED UP AND REMOVED THE SPILL SAFELY, USING SODIUM BICARBONATE AND ZEP ZORBENT.

item.title: Report E-2024030269
item.description:
Report E-2024030269

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 7, 2024, one (1) defective 275-gallon tote of UN1760 leaked approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior during transit. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the release and worked them in with hand tools. A forklift was utilized to perform a gravity transfer of the remaining product from the damaged 275-gallon tote into one (1) new 275-gallon tote. Additional granular absorbents were deployed to the trailer floor to remove any remaining material and worked in with hand tools. All UN1760-impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030242
item.description:
Report E-2024030242

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the terminal floor and estimated that half a gallon of material was released due to damage to the 330-gallon metal tote. Hepaco personnel stated that granular absorbents were deployed prior to their arrival by ESTES terminal personnel and Hepaco deployed additional granular absorbents along with chemical boom. No waste was generated from this response. A 330-gallon metal tote was ordered and Hepaco returned to the site to transfer the remaining from the damaged tote. The impacted absorbents were recovered and containerized into one 15-gallon metal drum along with the spent PPE. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024020474
item.description:
Report E-2024020474

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-27
  • City: MACEDONIA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LOGISTICS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling northbound on Route 8 and was attempting to take the ramp onto I 271 North. For unknown reasons, the KAG Energy, LLC driver lost control of the unit and and went off the overpass. The tractor and trailer were immediately engulfed in fire. 7497 gallons of diesel fuel being hauled on the trailer was lost. A nearby creek was impacted by the spilled diesel fuel. Hepaco Environmental and Atlas Environmental were dispatched to the scene and continue to remediate the release.
